name: The Updated Everclear Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the first single released from "Welcome to the Drama Club"?
questions.explanation:
Hater.

	"Hater" features Jesus exercising with his heavy cross and smoking. "Welcome to the Drama Club" was the first CD released by the band since their departure from Capitol Records.

questions.text: Who was NOT in the band for "Welcome to the Drama Club"?
questions.explanation:
Greg Eklund.

	Greg Eklund and Craig Montoya left the band in 2003, and Art Alexakis reformed the band in 2004. Dave French, Sam Hudson, Brett Snyder, Josh Crawley and Alexakis were the band for "Welcome to the Drama Club".

questions.text: Which religious symbol is NOT in the music video for "Hater"?
questions.explanation:
A loaf of bread.

	The music video for "Hater" features a suit-clad Jesus lifting his cross and wearing a crown of thorns throughout the video. However, a loaf of bread is not seen.

questions.text: According to "Glorious", where did the singer find Snow White?
questions.explanation:
In a downtown bar.

	"You were shining in a white lightLike a fairy tale movie starNever really thought I would find Snow White drinking in a downtown bar." Lead singer Art Alexakis announced that "Glorious" would be the second single from "Welcome to the Drama Club".

questions.text: What record label released "Welcome to the Drama Club"?
questions.explanation:
Eleven Seven Music.

	Founded by Allen Kovac, Eleven Seven Music works with bands that might potentially be added to a Warner Brothers label. They have worked with Buckcherry and Drowning Pool in addition to Everclear.

questions.text: What was Brett Snyder's position before becoming Everclear's drummer?
questions.explanation:
Drum tech.

	Brett was swapped for Eric Bretl in the summer of 2004. When I saw them live, he did amazing work!

questions.text: Everclear released a cover of which song in the summer of 2004?
questions.explanation:
This Land is Your Land.

	Written by Woody Guthrie in 1940, "This Land Is Your Land" was a response to the more unrealistic anthems of Irving Berlin. It is one of America's best-known folk songs.

questions.text: Who is listed as a producer on "Welcome to the Drama Club"?
questions.explanation:
Art Alexakis.

	Lead singer Art Alexakis has served as producer on all of Everclear's full-length albums. Sometimes credited as A.P. Alexakis, he has also dabbled in acting with a guest appearance on "Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide", on an episode that originally aired in 2006.

questions.text: Complete this song title: "Under the ___________ Stars".
questions.explanation:
Western.

	"Under The Western Stars" was the first song on "Welcome to the Drama Club". The following is a sample of the lyrics for the song: "We can lose ourselvesTonightUnderneath the western stars"

questions.text: What is the last hidden track from "Welcome to the Drama Club"?
questions.explanation:
Beautiful Dream.

	"I had a dream I was living by the oceanI had a dream I was living in the sunI wake up sad because I'm living in darknessI know I'm not aloneI know I'm not the only one I had a dream that I had no depressionI had a dream I had a smile on my faceI wake up hungry so I feed my obsessionI know I gotta leaveI know I gotta run away."
